thread.title: Boston Marathon bombing survivor engaged to firefighter who saved her
thread.title_full: Boston Marathon bombing survivor engaged to firefighter who saved her

title: Boston Marathon bombing survivor engaged to firefighter who saved her
text:
Boston Marathon bombing survivor engaged to firefighter who saved her Last updated 17:37, February 2 2017 
A woman who lost her leg in the Boston Marathon bombing is now engaged to the firefighter who saved her. 
Roseann Sdoia tells The New York Post that she and firefighter Mike Materia got engaged during a trip to Nantucket in December. REUTERD 
Roseann Sdoia crosses the finish line in a 2014 tribute run in Boston. 
Sdoia was standing near the finish line during the 2013 Boston Marathon when the bombs went off, badly mangling her leg. 
﻿ 
﻿ Roseann Sdoia and firefighter Mike Materia met in the most terrrible of circumstances. 
Materia rushed to help her, and stayed with her on the ride to the hospital. 
"In the hospital, my mom tried to set me up with him," Sdoia said. 
"She was like, 'Oh, did you see that firefighter? He's so cute.' And I was like, 'Mom, I just got blown up.' " 
Materia continued to visit her in intensive care and they struck up a friendship. Ad Feedback 
Two months after the bombing, they went on their first date. 
They plan to marry this year, and are releasing a book next month titled Perfect Strangers about four people affected by the bombing. - AP
